greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of a(n,k) = number of minimal covers of an n-set that cover k points of that set uniquely (n >= 1, k >= 1).
link: T. Hearne and C. G. Wagner, Minimal covers of finite sets, Discr. Math. 5 (1973), 247-251.
formula: a(n, k) = C(n, k)*Sum_{j=1..k} S(k, j)*(2^j-j-1)^(n-k), where S(k, j) are Stirling numbers of the second kind.
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := Binomial[n, k] * Sum[ StirlingS2[k, j]*(2^j - j - 1)^(n - k), {j, 1, k}]; a[n_, n_] := Sum[ StirlingS2[n, j], {j, 1, n}]; Flatten[ Table[a[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 26 2012, from formula *)
xref: Cf. A056885 for unlabeled case. Row sums give A046165.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
